column4: My problem is as follows..I have a SMB network hard drive. I can see the shares if I use network lookup. but for some reason I cannot mount the share. I want to use Amarok but I guess it needs a mnt to build the collection. I get the following. sudo mount //192.168.2.74/music  /media/music/ -o username=XXXX,password=XXX,dmask=777,fmask=777
mount: Not a directory....  Any suggestions?
smbmount
so should the command be sudo smbmount ?
try
depends how your stuff is configured
I get smbmount: command not found.
you could also try mount -t smbfs
or mount -t cifs

both mount -t smbfs and cifs give the error mount: Not a directory. this is the command I used. sudo mount -t cifs //192.168.2.74/music /media/music/ -o username=XXXXX,password=XXX,dmask=777,fmask=777
hmm have you created /media/music dir?
yes I have.
install smbclient and try this
smbclient //share/mount -username=user -p
then you can see if smblcient can access this share at all
i can access the share every whch way. but just cannot mount it for some bizare reason.
try to mount it in your home directory, maybe some kind of permission problem
smb share on a network attached hard drive.
I can view the share from nautilus and dolphin ect...
what is the command I should have in fstab?
Duke_Fluke. Got it working thanx. found out I didnt have SMBFS installed. all fixed now thanx again.
no problem
